page.title: 07MARSHLAND TRADITION
page.content: Most of the marshland West of Gt.Yarmouth is let on an annual basis. Yearly auctions are held at various public houses.'The Bell' at Haddiscoe is the setting for one such auction where the triangular area of marshland bounded by the rivers Yare, Waveney and the connecting New Cut, known as the 'Island' are let to the highest bidder.It is said that until quite recently people were born, lived and died on the 'island' without ever leaving its confines. Recent interest in country crafts has given a boost to reed cutting.This arduous task is now highly lucrative, but provides very few days employment. There are now few willing to endure the life of the old 'marshmen' whose year-long labours included ditching stock management, water level and reed management.
